keyword: how many calories is in one fried egg
title: How Many Calories in One Fried Egg?
meta_description: Discover how many calories is in one fried egg, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
h1: How Many Calories in One Fried Egg?
assumptions: Large egg (~50 g), fried sunny-side up in 1 tsp vegetable oil, no added salt.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by egg size, oil type/amount, cooking method, and additions; check packaging when available.

quick_answer.text: One large fried egg provides ~92 kcal and ~6 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp butter instead of oil

faqs.q: How many calories is in one fried egg?
faqs.a: About 92 kcal for one large fried egg in minimal oil.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a fried egg?
faqs.a: Roughly 6.3 g protein per large fried egg.

faqs.q: Does frying add more calories than boiling?
faqs.a: Yes, frying adds ~14 kcal from oil compared to boiled (78 kcal).

faqs.q: How much fat is in one fried egg?
faqs.a: About 7 g total fat, including 2 g saturated fat.

faqs.q: Can I reduce calories in a fried egg?
faqs.a: Yes, use non-stick pan without oil for ~52 kcal, or opt for poached/boiled.
